title: F1 legend defends Lewis Hamilton after 'hypocritical' comments over environmental fears
text:

Formula One legend Damon Hill says Lewis Hamilton's jet-setting lifestyle opened him up to deserved criticism - but has backed his fellow Brit's controversial environmental concerns.

Hamilton, who is on the verge of winning a sixth F1 world title, recently urged his fans to go vegan and worryingly said he feels like "giving up on everything" due to his fears about the environment.

But the 34-year-old superstar has caused a stir, given he often travels via private jet to attend the F1 races which are held all over the world.

Hamilton's Mercedes team are also sponsored by Petronas, a Malaysian oil and gas company, while the Brit is known to enjoy time away from the track by globe-trotting and mixing with a-list celebrities on luxury yachts.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

And Hill, the 1996 F1 world champion, understands the criticism aimed his way - but says Hamilton has the right to try and make the world a better place.

He wrote on Twitter: "Lewis will get no end of flack for this, being a jet stetting F1 star. We are all hypocritical to greater or lesser degrees.

"But if people like him don't speak out then we all carry on in the same vein and don't even try to change. Its not that bad, eating carrots."

Hamilton switched to a plant-based diet in 2017 and in September he helped launch a vegan burger restaurant in London.

He raised fears among the Formula One fraternity on Tuesday after posting worrying social media messages in which he says he feels like "giving up on everything".

He wrote on Instagram : "Honestly, I feel like giving up on everything. Shut down completely. Why bother when the world is such a mess and people don't seem to care.

"I'm going to take a moment away to gather my thoughts. Thank you to those of you who do give a damn about the world."

His comments were blasted by some fans on Twitter, with one user highlighting Hamilton's extravagant lifestyle.

(Image: XPB Images/Press Association Images)

He wrote: "Lewis Hamilton; Owns a £25 million private jet. Races cars for a living. Has a £13 million car collection. Owns a £3 million yacht.

"Avoided taxes on his jet using tax avoidance scheme. Sponsored by Petronas, a Malaysian oil and gas company."

The somewhat controversial tweet received over 8,000 likes, while another fan added: "Don’t forget how his car gets to where the race is held. By plane or boat. Full of diesel, plus generators. So nothing environmentally ‘perfect’ there."
description: Lewis Hamilton urged his fans to go vegan and said he feels like "giving up on everything" due to his concerns about the environment
